definitions.definition: A wager , an agreement between two parties that a stake (usually money) will be paid by the loser to the winner (the winner being the one who correctly forecast the outcome of an event).
examples: Dylan owes Fletcher $30 from an unsuccessful bet .

definitions.definition: ( Philippines , figuratively , informal ) A candidate (for elections and pageants ) or competitor (in multinational sports).
Indicating a degree of certainty , or that something can be relied upon.
examples: It’s a safe bet that it will rain tomorrow.
There's a decent bet that we'll be able to reach the top of that hill in an hour.
It’s an even bet that Jim will come top of the maths test tomorrow.
There's a good bet that Sally will arrive later.

main_definition: A wager , an agreement between two parties that a stake (usually money) will be paid by the loser to the winner (the winner being the one who correctly forecast the outcome of an event).
secondary_definitions: ( Philippines , figuratively , informal ) A candidate (for elections and pageants ) or competitor (in multinational sports).
Indicating a degree of certainty , or that something can be relied upon.

definitions.definition: Alternative form of beth ( “ Semitic letter ” ) .

main_definition: Alternative form of beth ( “ Semitic letter ” ) .
